recommendations.name: Joel Alenchery
recommendations.headline: Engineering Manager | Imagineering human AI interfaces @ Aleph Alpha
recommendations.text:
I've had the rare privilege of working with Sohel at two different companies, and I can confidently say he's one of the most talented engineers I've encountered.

I first recruited Sohel as a frontend engineer at Nexsales, and he immediately brought a level of design sophistication and UX intuition that transformed our products. He has that rare combination of technical excellence and an innate eye for what makes a great user experience. What impressed me most was watching him grow beyond his frontend roots - he eagerly took on the challenge of working across the full stack, all while maintaining his passion for creating delightful user experiences. Together, we built a complete product from the ground up - from user requirement analysis through UX design, implementation, and rollout.

When I started building the UI platform team at Forto and learned Sohel was being onboarded as an engineer, I didn't hesitate to bring him onto my team. As one of the founding engineers, Sohel brought a developer relations mindset to how we approached design system adoptionâ€”not from prior experience, but from his intuitive understanding of what engineers need and how to build trust. He understood that technology adoption is ultimately about people - he listened to user feedback, solved real problems, and built genuine trust in our UI platform team. The result? Significantly better adoption rates and user engagement.

He has a remarkable ability to dive into projects with little context and drive them to successful completion through thorough research and consensus-building. Every rollout he led was smooth, with minimal disruption, because he understood that technical success and human factors are inseparable.

This same thoughtful approach made Sohel an exceptional mentor and team builder. When friction emerged within the team - as it inevitably does in any growing organization - Sohel actively worked to bridge gaps and foster understanding. He has a gift for bringing varied perspectives into conversations, helping team members see issues from different angles and find common ground. Rather than avoiding difficult dynamics, he leaned into them with empathy and patience, facilitating discussions that helped the team not just resolve conflicts, but grow stronger because of them. His mentorship extended beyond technical guidance; he genuinely invested in helping other engineers develop both their skills and their ability to collaborate effectively.

What truly sets Sohel apart isn't just his technical prowess or his interpersonal skills in isolation - it's that he's a humble and genuinely caring human being who brings these qualities together to elevate everyone around him.

It was an absolute pleasure working with Sohel, and I hope our paths cross again professionally. I would highly recommend Sohel for any product-focused engineering role that values strong UX, pragmatic engineering, and collaborative problem-solving.
